name: opposition
content:
opposition noun
(DISAGREEMENT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
C1 [ U ] strong disagreement: There is a lot of opposition to the proposed changes. The unions are in opposition to the government over the issue of increasing the minimum wage.
More examplesFewer examplesPlans to desegregate the schools met with opposition.She left home in the face of strong opposition from her parents.The company took no heed of public opposition to the plans.The strength of the opposition was rather more than she'd bargained for.The plan for a new office tower went ahead regardless of local opposition.

(SPORT)
the opposition C1 [ S, + sing/pl verb ]
